trans-unit.source: How to authorize developer accounts using Azure Active Directory in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to authorize developer accounts using Azure Active Directory in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to authorize users using Azure Active Directory in API Management.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to authorize users using Azure Active Directory in API Management.

trans-unit.source: How to authorize developer accounts using Azure Active Directory in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to authorize developer accounts using Azure Active Directory in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Vue d'ensemble
trans-unit.target: Vue d'ensemble

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to enable access to the developer portal for all users in one or more Azure Active Directories.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to enable access to the developer portal for all users in one or more Azure Active Directories.

trans-unit.source: This guide also shows you how to manage groups of Azure Active Directory users by adding external groups that contain the users of an Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: This guide also shows you how to manage groups of Azure Active Directory users by adding external groups that contain the users of an Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: To complete the steps in this guide you must first have an Azure Active Directory in which to create an application.
trans-unit.target: To complete the steps in this guide you must first have an Azure Active Directory in which to create an application.

trans-unit.source: How to authorize developer accounts using Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: How to authorize developer accounts using Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: To get started, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To get started, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <link><linkText>Create an API Management service instance[]</linkText><title></title></link> in the <link><linkText>Get started with Azure API Management[]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <link><linkText>Create an API Management service instance[]</linkText><title></title></link> in the <link><linkText>Get started with Azure API Management[]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click Sécurité de la Gestion de l'API menu on the left and click External Identities.
trans-unit.target: Click Sécurité de la Gestion de l'API menu on the left and click External Identities.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>External Identities</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>External Identities</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Click Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the Redirect URL and switch over to your Azure Active Directory in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the Redirect URL and switch over to your Azure Active Directory in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>External Identities</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>External Identities</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Add button to create a new Azure Active Directory application, and choose Add an application my organization is developing.
trans-unit.target: Click the Add button to create a new Azure Active Directory application, and choose Add an application my organization is developing.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add new Azure Active Directory application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add new Azure Active Directory application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the application, select Web application and/or Web API, and click the next button.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the application, select Web application and/or Web API, and click the next button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Azure Active Directory application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Azure Active Directory application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For Sign-on URL, copy the Redirect URL de la Azure Active Directory section of the External Identities tab in the publisher portal and remove the -aad suffix from the end of the URL.
trans-unit.target: For Sign-on URL, copy the Redirect URL de la Azure Active Directory section of the External Identities tab in the publisher portal and remove the -aad suffix from the end of the URL.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the Sign-on URL est https://aad03.portal.current.int-azure-api.net/signin.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the Sign-on URL est https://aad03.portal.current.int-azure-api.net/signin.

trans-unit.source: For the App ID URL, enter either the default domain or a custom domain for the Azure Active Directory, and append a unique string to it.
trans-unit.target: For the App ID URL, enter either the default domain or a custom domain for the Azure Active Directory, and append a unique string to it.

trans-unit.source: In this example the default domain of https://contoso5api.onmicrosoft.com is used with the suffix of /API specified.
trans-unit.target: In this example the default domain of https://contoso5api.onmicrosoft.com is used with the suffix of /API specified.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Azure Active Directory application properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Azure Active Directory application properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the check button to save and create the new application, and switch to the Configure tab to configure the new application.
trans-unit.target: Click the check button to save and create the new application, and switch to the Configure tab to configure the new application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Azure Active Directory application created</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Azure Active Directory application created</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If multiple Azure Active Directories are going to be used for this application, click Yes for Application is multi-tenant.
trans-unit.target: If multiple Azure Active Directories are going to be used for this application, click Yes for Application is multi-tenant.

trans-unit.source: The default is No.
trans-unit.target: The default is No.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application is multi-tenant</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application is multi-tenant</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Copy the Redirect URL de la Azure Active Directory section of the External Identities tab in the publisher portal and paste it into the Reply URL text box.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Redirect URL de la Azure Active Directory section of the External Identities tab in the publisher portal and paste it into the Reply URL text box.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Reply URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Reply URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Scroll to the bottom of the configure tab, select the Application Permissions drop-down, and check Read directory data.
trans-unit.target: Scroll to the bottom of the configure tab, select the Application Permissions drop-down, and check Read directory data.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Permissions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Permissions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the Delegate Permissions drop-down, and check Enable sign-on and read users' profiles.
trans-unit.target: Select the Delegate Permissions drop-down, and check Enable sign-on and read users' profiles.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Delegated Permissions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Delegated Permissions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For more information about application and delegated permissions, see <link><linkText>Accessing the Graph API[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about application and delegated permissions, see <link><linkText>Accessing the Graph API[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Client Id to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Client Id to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Client Id</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Client Id</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Switch back to the publisher portal and paste in the Client Id copied from the Azure Active Directory application configuration.
trans-unit.target: Switch back to the publisher portal and paste in the Client Id copied from the Azure Active Directory application configuration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Client Id</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Client Id</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Switch back to the Azure Active Directory configuration, and click the Select duration drop-down in the Keys section and specify an interval.
trans-unit.target: Switch back to the Azure Active Directory configuration, and click the Select duration drop-down in the Keys section and specify an interval.

trans-unit.source: In this example 1 year is used.
trans-unit.target: In this example 1 year is used.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Key</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Key</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Save to save the configuration and display the key.
trans-unit.target: Click Save to save the configuration and display the key.

trans-unit.source: Copy the key to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Copy the key to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of this key.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of this key.

trans-unit.source: Once you close the Azure Active Directory configuration window, the key cannot be displayed again.
trans-unit.target: Once you close the Azure Active Directory configuration window, the key cannot be displayed again.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Key</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Key</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Switch back to the publisher portal and paste the key into the Client Secret text box.
trans-unit.target: Switch back to the publisher portal and paste the key into the Client Secret text box.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Client Secret</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Client Secret</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Allowed Tenants specifies which directories have access to the APIs of the API Management service instance.
trans-unit.target: Allowed Tenants specifies which directories have access to the APIs of the API Management service instance.

trans-unit.source: Specify the domains of the Azure Active Directory instances to which you want to grant access.
trans-unit.target: Specify the domains of the Azure Active Directory instances to which you want to grant access.

trans-unit.source: You can separate multiple domains with newlines, spaces, or commas.
trans-unit.target: You can separate multiple domains with newlines, spaces, or commas.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Allowed tenants</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Allowed tenants</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Multiple domains can be specified in the Allowed Tenants section.
trans-unit.target: Multiple domains can be specified in the Allowed Tenants section.

trans-unit.source: Before any user can log in from a different domain than the original domain where the application was registered, a global administrator of the different domain must grant permission for the application to access directory data.
trans-unit.target: Before any user can log in from a different domain than the original domain where the application was registered, a global administrator of the different domain must grant permission for the application to access directory data.

trans-unit.source: To grant permission, a global administrator must log in to the application and click Accept.
trans-unit.target: To grant permission, a global administrator must log in to the application and click Accept.

trans-unit.source: In the following example miaoaad.onmicrosoft.com has been added to Allowed Tenants and a global administrator from that domain is logging in for the first time.
trans-unit.target: In the following example miaoaad.onmicrosoft.com has been added to Allowed Tenants and a global administrator from that domain is logging in for the first time.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Permissions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Permissions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If a non-global administrator tries to log in before permissions are granted by a global administrator, the login attempt fails and an error screen is displayed.
trans-unit.target: If a non-global administrator tries to log in before permissions are granted by a global administrator, the login attempt fails and an error screen is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Once the desired configuration is specified, click Save.
trans-unit.target: Once the desired configuration is specified, click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Save</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Save</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the changes are saved, the users in the specified Azure Active Directory can log into the Developer portal by following the steps in <link><linkText>Log in to the Developer portal using an Azure Active Directory account[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Once the changes are saved, the users in the specified Azure Active Directory can log into the Developer portal by following the steps in <link><linkText>Log in to the Developer portal using an Azure Active Directory account[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: How to add an external Azure Active Directory Group
trans-unit.target: How to add an external Azure Active Directory Group

trans-unit.source: After enabling access for users in an Azure Active Directory, you can add Azure Active Directory groups into API Management to more easily manage the association of the developers in the group with the desired products.
trans-unit.target: After enabling access for users in an Azure Active Directory, you can add Azure Active Directory groups into API Management to more easily manage the association of the developers in the group with the desired products.

trans-unit.source: In order to configure an external Azure Active Directory group, the Azure Active Directory must first be configured in the Identities tab by following the procedure in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: In order to configure an external Azure Active Directory group, the Azure Active Directory must first be configured in the Identities tab by following the procedure in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: External Azure Active Directory groups are added from the Visibility tab of the product for which you wish to grant access to the group.
trans-unit.target: External Azure Active Directory groups are added from the Visibility tab of the product for which you wish to grant access to the group.

trans-unit.source: Click Products, and then click the name of the desired product.
trans-unit.target: Click Products, and then click the name of the desired product.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure product</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure product</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Switch to the Visibility tab, and click Add Groups from Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Switch to the Visibility tab, and click Add Groups from Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add groups</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add groups</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the Azure Active Directory Tenant from the drop-down list, and then type the name of the desired group in the Groups to be added text box.
trans-unit.target: Select the Azure Active Directory Tenant from the drop-down list, and then type the name of the desired group in the Groups to be added text box.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This group name can be found in the Groups list for your Azure Active Directory, as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: This group name can be found in the Groups list for your Azure Active Directory, as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Active Directory Groups List</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Active Directory Groups List</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add to validate the group name and add the group.
trans-unit.target: Click Add to validate the group name and add the group.

trans-unit.source: In this example the Contoso 5 Developers external group is added.
trans-unit.target: In this example the Contoso 5 Developers external group is added.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Group added</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Group added</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Save to save the new group selection.
trans-unit.target: Click Save to save the new group selection.

trans-unit.source: Once an Azure Azure Active Directory group has been configured from one product, it is available to be checked on the Visibility tab for the other products in the API Management service instance.
trans-unit.target: Once an Azure Azure Active Directory group has been configured from one product, it is available to be checked on the Visibility tab for the other products in the API Management service instance.

trans-unit.source: To review and configure the properties for external groups once they have been added, click on the name of the group from the Groups tab.
trans-unit.target: To review and configure the properties for external groups once they have been added, click on the name of the group from the Groups tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage groups</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage groups</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From here you can edit the Name and the Description of the group.
trans-unit.target: From here you can edit the Name and the Description of the group.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Edit group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Edit group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Users from the configured Azure Active Directory can log into the Developer portal and view and subscribe to any groups for which they have visibility by following the instructions in the following section.
trans-unit.target: Users from the configured Azure Active Directory can log into the Developer portal and view and subscribe to any groups for which they have visibility by following the instructions in the following section.

trans-unit.source: How to log in to the Developer portal using an Azure Active Directory account
trans-unit.target: How to log in to the Developer portal using an Azure Active Directory account

trans-unit.source: To log into the Developer portal using an Azure Active Directory account configured in the previous sections, open a new browser window using the Sign-on URL from the Active Directory application configuration, and click Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: To log into the Developer portal using an Azure Active Directory account configured in the previous sections, open a new browser window using the Sign-on URL from the Active Directory application configuration, and click Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Developer Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Developer Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter the credentials of one of the users in your Azure Active Directory, and click Sign in.
trans-unit.target: Enter the credentials of one of the users in your Azure Active Directory, and click Sign in.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sign in</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sign in</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You may be prompted with a registration form if any additional information is required.
trans-unit.target: You may be prompted with a registration form if any additional information is required.

trans-unit.source: Complete the registration form and click Sign up.
trans-unit.target: Complete the registration form and click Sign up.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Registration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Registration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Your user is now logged into the developer portal for your API Management service instance.
trans-unit.target: Your user is now logged into the developer portal for your API Management service instance.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Registration Complete</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Registration Complete</linkText>
